comments.commentBody: Let's assume that some people report that they sense that it is wrong for them to share bathroom facilities with (unrelated) persons of a different biological sex, that it somehow infringes on their identity as a person of their biological sex.  Should we accommodate such people?  Or should we tell them that their understanding of their own identity is wrong?

It's not just about bathrooms. It's locker rooms, shower areas etc. perhaps it mystifies you because as a man you are not used to looking over your shoulder to make sure you are safe, let alone having to do it in a locker room where you are naked and vulnerable.

You, as a man, frankly have no business commenting on the security and privacy issues that women are worried about, with this current push to allow any male who identifies as a woman to freely use women's toilets and change rooms.

In the Taipei area, at least, the most common public toilets are in the METRO system where it is quite ordinary to see women attendants cleaning the men's toilets while men are using them.

In a few Taipei parks, I have encountered police officers pretending to be gay but doing that so badly they are rather obvious. I've never actually been hit on by a gay man other than at an all men's hot spring.

What mystifies me is why anybody cares who else is using the same restroom?

Yeah, Barry, it's sad John can't tell a tray from a platter. The tray is classic. And the newspaper is the way they did it in Aberdeen before the newfangled rolls of paper.

I'll give you the beer. Elaine wanted wine and it's a big enough chardonnay to stand up to my spice mixture, which is way more crab shack than that fancy Old Bay stuff. But we've had that discussion.

The tater tots are in lieu of hushpuppies. The green stuff is healthy so we might live to eat another day.

God makes an enormous amount of junk and most of it fails to survive. God is the master abortionist!

But some of that junk turns out to be what thrives in the latest version of our constantly changing environment.

"God's Junk," as we call it, is critical to the very persistence of life. At the same time, death allows the recycling of raw materials critical to the existence of life.

So "Junk" and "Death" are what have allowed us to be here! Enjoy your existence and stop complaining!

As someone who bought the house I needed (rather than the max I could afford), I was frustrated by the small amount of tax deduction it gave me. Basically, the bulk of the mortgage deduction was one I could have had anyway by using the standard deduction. I eventually decided to cash in stock and pay off the house, and have taken the standard deduction ever since. Most homeowners who itemize don't realize that the big beneficiaries are really the rich with the million dollar homes that are reaping most of the federal subsidy. If we made it a standard amount for each family (instead of basing it on the size of your house), it would be fairer, and less of a subsidy to the rich. But they have the power, so don't expect it to change without a big political fight. One that the banks and realtors will be happy to fight on behalf of their rich customers.

They are letting thousands of "refugees" in with little or no vetting and no wait. The people coming illegally across our southern border completely skip the process. We have millions for foreign nationals in this country who we know nothing about. We can't do anything about the dead weight U.S citizens we have, but we can deport the trouble making non-citizens and keep the losers from coming in.

You should be afraid of people with guns. And, you should read up on US-foreign policy so you can understand why Muslims are afraid of us - we've killed plenty in the war on terror. Then you might be able to see the relationship between jihadism and all its forms and US imperialism in all its finest, bloodiest moments.

Have you ever met one? Maybe you should start by finding out for yourself, instead of listening to a narcissistic windbag who is utterly incapable of governing the most powerful nation in human history.

Certainly agree with you about due diligence but vetting Muslims would not have han any utility in dealing with mass shootings at Virgina Tech, Aurora, Sandy Hook Elementary, Umpqua Community College, and many others.  The common element with Orlando is these attacks were all carried out by young men using weapons with substantial magazines. it is time to stop being politically correct and ban men under 45 or 50 from owning or using weapons holding more than three rounds. If you cannot kill a deer or stop a home invasion with 3 well-placed rounds you are not likely to do it with 20. Disarm young killers.

It's not necessarily "political correctness."  We have always been pressured from childhood in this country not to be a 'tattle-tale," "stoolie," or "rat."  On top of that, people "don't want to get involved."  It is about time we had a national discussion that has only been vaguely mentioned:  If you see something, say something.  And the police, FBI and CIA need to take citizen reporting seriously, and the Republican Congress needs to fund it.

Trump is calling for reviewing the vetting process for Muslims who want to emigrate to the USA...nothing wrong with that given what's been happening. Why wouldn't we want to do due diligence? Officials have already observed patterns of behavior that could be potentially harmful to the general population. Not to take extra measures with particular group  would just be inviting future casualties . Folks get over 'political correctness' - already people who knew the killer thought something was peculiar but were afraid to speak out. Political correctness has proven to be a killer - 50 people this week alone.

Wrong again, Donald.  This attack and others like it show that banning guns is the answer, because all the other measures have failed or will fail.  The Australians banned guns, all of Europe does it.  The U.S. can do it.

"And why are you so intellectually lazy that all you can do is repeatedly throw out the term 'political correctness' or some bastardization of that term..."

Thank you, Randall Roark.

Using the logic (or lack there of) of Donald Trump and a number of those who have commented here then whom should we ban based on the terrorists behind Sandy Hook, the church in South Carolina, Columbine, Oklahoma City, and so many more?  And why are you so intellectually lazy that all you can do is repeatedly throw out the term 'political correctness' or some bastardization of that term to support a complete disregard for our Constitution and for all those who have fought and died to protect what it stands for.  I'll be damned if I (and I am sure many others) let any muslim extremist or christian extremist or white supremacist or racist or homophobe or whatever or especially you fascists who would so easily dispense with what makes this country truly great.  One writer said we should do anything it takes to protect our citizens but to me not if it means giving up our souls.

Nice. Would it also include the Japanese, they sowed a lot of terror at Pearl. So no more Japanese may enter. Turn the planes back! Tim McVey blew up a federal building, including a day care center, murdering dozens. Hmmm. Should we look into what sure sounds Scottish, that McVey. All Scots are hereby prohibited until we can "find out what's really going on--hint hint--that's birther-speak for Obama being a Muslim--he's behind all this, now you now know "what's really going on."

Trump wants "a ban on migrants from any part of the world with 'a proven history of terrorism' against the United States or its allies."

Would he ban Irish citizens from the U.S. because of the IRA's attacks on Great Britain, our greatest ally? Going back only slightly further, would he deport himself since the Germans made war against the U.S. and its allies?

If such a ban would lead to his deportation, I must say it would be tough not to support it.

Who cares what it's called? As if somehow using those words will change anything? That's absurd. Timothy McVeight wasn't a Muslim. Most murders that occur in the United States every day aren't done by Muslims, but instead by Americans, yet somehow Muslims are the danger?

The danger to America isn't Islam. The danger to America is the shocking ignorance of the American people, who like to think so highly of themselves, but clearly cannot justify that status. It's sad to realize that mankind has advanced its technology, but it's people can remain so incredibly stupid.
Poor horrified person: when Taoists engage in mass murder, they too will become persona non grata. Until then, we are entitled to draw reasonable distinctions.

I am HORRIFIED.
The Republican party standard bearer calls, supported by his party, for a ban on Muslim entering the US. Then maybe it will follow with a ban on Hindu, or Buddhist, or Taoist ...... you name it. Once you start discriminating based on religious belief the end game is an official State approved religion (Baptist?) and all others not allowed. Trump wants to transform us into a faith based State. What about not selling assault weapons to individuals???

"I would like to clarify the true meaning of Pluralism, which is 2 enity's [sic] (Liberals and conservatives) which battle each other over things that are not actually important and really have no substance...."

How true, Tradewind. Like Kilkenny cats...

"There once were two cats of Kilkenny,
Each thought there was one cat too many,
So they fought and they fit,
And they scratched and they bit,
Till, excepting their nails
And the tips of their tails,
Instead of two cats, there weren't any!"

I would like to clarify the true meaning of Pluralism, which is 2 enity's (Liberals and conservatives) which battle each other over things that are not actually important and really have no substance but will keep the attention of the public (that's you and me) while things that are being taken away from us, the very things our fore fathers, family members, close friends, and neighbors have fought and bled for. Things such as freedoms to raise our children to love and respect their parents and not have a school employee who has never had or raised a child delagating to you how to raise your child, To actually have a say with our vote instead of somehow having a system that tells you who is going to hold office through some kind of delagating vote that really dosen't make much since to most of us. Regardless of your or my belief our country is a mess and it is due to poor stewardship and greed. Greed for money, Greed for Power, Not sure how to fix this mess however there are a lot of good people in this country and I believe if we pull together for the truth we can.

Let's all work together to ban the sale of assault weapons in the United States.

I can't think of a better way to honor those who were killed in Orlando and the hundreds of other innocent who came before them.

Draw against Ireland, the weakest team in the group, doesn't bode all that well, even with four third place teams advancing. He ain't the only creakingly old Swede. Sebastian Larsson, who can't even get a start at relegation threatened Sunderland...Maybe Freddie Ljungberg isn't doing anything this summer, either...

Very thought provoking and dry. I thought the dynamic between Farrell, Weisz and the leader of the loners was fascinating. The most interesting aspect I haven't seen commented on anywhere was that it was primarily women heartlessly controlling the rules on both sides--the couples and the loners. The men are obedient. And the punishment which is inflicted on Weisz is not surprising, in terms of the viciousness women can inflict on each other in real life under the guise of concern, when it's really all about control. While I see by reviews that some viewers were appalled and disturbed by the ending, I have to say, it is only a movie and the sacrifice suggested is not very different from some of the fairy tales I grew up hearing.
I wish more had been made of the turning into an animal premise. As it was used in the movie it just seems like an off-camera plot gimmick but not used to any meaningful effect in the story. I did notice a camel strolling through the woods, but that was it. Also, the idea of being single meaning you will one day choke to death eating alone was a very funny running joke in 30 Rock several years ago.
Ireland versus Sweden on the pitch! Must be a slow sports news day!! Yawn...

A small step to help racing win back the trust of its fans is not what is needed.  It's time for horses to be running free across the plains rather than around racetracks.  The world is changing and the idea that other species are here to entertain us is finally being seen as archaic. Let's encourage that new and wonderful mindset rather than encouraging a little reform in a system based on an ugly hierarchy.
"He is unnecessarily whipping up Islamophobia." No - it's completely necessary for him to whip up Islamophobia. Hatred and fear of Muslims and Mexicans is the wya he thinks he'll win the Presidency.

Mr.Trump wishes to hijack this mass shooting incident to suit his convenience. He is unnecessarily whipping up Islamophobia. He is trying to portray a picture as though all Muslims are terrorists. But he is forgetting the fact that there are plenty of Muslim Soldiers in the U.S. Military, who have sacrificed their lives and limbs for upholding the honour of the nation. Even today, U.S. military has Muslim soldiers.

Every Muslim living in the U.S. has his roots in Asia and Arabian Peninsula. Therefore, in a way all as immigrants only. Muslims in the U.S., have tried hard, especially after 911, to prove that they are as patriotic as any other citizen in the U.S. If Mr.Trump continues to use such language, it will only alienate the community.

There were 372 mass shootings in the US in 2015, killing 475 people and wounding 1,870, according to the Mass Shooting Tracker.

Where was your outage when American Christians murdered Americans? How convenient that it only appears to be reserved for Muslims. Does that mean you're okay with the rampant gun violence in America that doesn't involve Muslims?
This was an American citizen born of Muslim immigrant parents. Lots of similar cases in France, where many radicalized Muslims are French-born, but not thinking/reasoning like native French people.

Bob: if the first generation father had been banned--you know, he of the "there's no need to do what my son did because God Himself will punish depravity" faith--there wouldn't have been a second.

This joker was a testament to the idiocy of automatic birthright citizenship and an utterly unassimilated murderer. (Quick quiz: does Sweden have birthright citizenship? Luxembourg?)
I thought his point was about immigrant Muslims, not American Muslims.
Fifth column, Bob? Something to think about...
Whatever one thinks of Mr Trump, one has to admit that the Orlando nightclub mass shooting played right into his hands and proved his point.

It's a natural reaction. Although it might be abhorrent in some respects, stereotyping serves purpose - it's a survival mechanism that allows us to sum up a situation or person quickly. That first impression can clearly be amended and revised with additional data....but there's a reason why it's a natural response to perceived danger. In our politically correct society though, that natural reaction can be problematical. Recall when former NPR reporter Juan Williams (now @ FOX), innocently mentioned that he gets a bit afraid when he observes people in Muslim garb when he boards a plane. He lost his job. So to survive in today's politically correct atmosphere one has to fight against natural impulses.
I completely agree, Jason... But keep in mind that radical Islamists can bring death to thousands of other means. The horrors of 9/11 are just one example...

I think what we are talking about is how a bigoted, hateful person in the name of a "greater cause" can kill 50 ppl in our own country. Assault rifles are all of the mass killers' instruments.  How do you limit those types of war based weapons from turning against us. There are a lot of misguided killers out there... The right to bear such instruments of mass death needs to be thoughtfully rethought to protect us. We have the most freedoms in the world and yet have the most deaths of any non-warring state.
